markdownRemark.html:
I’m sure I’ll write a lot more interesting things in the future.

A salted duck egg is a Chinese preserved food product made by soaking duck eggs in brine, or packing each egg in damp, salted charcoal. In Asian firm-textured, round yolk that is bright orange-red in color.
